section.name: Welcome to Wicket
section.p: Wicket is a Java web application framework that takes simplicity, separation of concerns and ease of development to a whole new level. Wicket pages can be mocked up, previewed and later revised using standard WYSIWYG HTML design tools. Dynamic content processing and form handling is all handled in Java code using a Swing-like component model backed by POJO data beans that can easily be persisted with Hibernate.

li.a: how easy it is to get started

section.name: Latest News
section.p: See the news archive for more (older) news.

subsection.name: December 9, 2004 - New style for the website
subsection.p: Our new layout, design and logo were kindly provided by Topicus by providing precious time of their designer Wouter de Jong.

subsection.name: December 5, 2004 - 0.9.14-alpha released
subsection.p: The current status of CVS was released under version 0.9.14-alpha.

subsection.name: November 7, 2004 - Clover license obtained
subsection.p: We have obtained a license for use in our project. This allows us to obtain even higher quality code than before. Thanks to Cenqua for providing us with the open source license.

section.name: Special thanks
section.p: The Wicket development team would like to thank the following partners for supporting the Open Source movement in general and Wicket in particular. Without them, Wicket would not be where it is now.

tr.td: Licensing the code coverage tool Clover.
Licensing the CPU and memory profiler YourKit.
